title: With 0-days hitting Chrome, iOS, and dozens more this month, is no software safe?
description: With 70 zero-days uncovered so far this year, 2023 is on track to set a new record.

title: Even more Google layoffs: This time it’s “significant” cuts to recruiting
description: Google plans to slow down hiring, and that means fewer recruiters.

title: AI can now generate CD-quality music from text, and it’s only getting better
description: Musicians: Speak now or forever hold your beats.

title: Dealmaster: Coffee gear, iPhone 15 accessory discounts, and more
description: We have the usual tech stuff and some extras for making the day-to-day easier.

title: Calif. passes strongest right-to-repair bill yet, requiring 7 years of parts
description: Repair shops must disclose if they're using "non-authorized" parts.

title: Biden called Arizona fab a “game-changer.” Analyst calls it a “paperweight”
description: Advanced chips made in America would still be shipped to Taiwan, report says.

title: A NASA astronaut will finally spend a full year in space
description: "I'm really excited to see how my body does when I return."

title: Feds open up $100 million funding for EV charger reliability grants
description: The first round of funds will go to repairing or replacing current infrastructure.

title: SpaceX projected 20 million Starlink users by 2022—it ended up with 1 million
description: Starlink has a fraction of the projected $12B revenue and 20M users, WSJ says.

title: Unity’s new “per-install” pricing enrages the game development community
description: Fees of up to $0.20 per install threaten to upend large chunks of the industry.

title: For the first time, research reveals crows use statistical logic
description: The birds can associate images with distinct reward probabilities.

title: Ford wants to double sales of hybrid F-150 pickup trucks, cuts price
description: 10 percent of F-150 sales are hybrid; Ford wants that to be 20 percent for MY24.

title: What would it take to build a self-sustaining astronaut ecosystem on Mars?
description: We're getting closer to bioregenerative life support systems for astronauts.
